title: Bitter Glory: Poland and its Fate 1918-1939
description: Watt tells the story of the painful birth, tormented life, and cataclysmic death of the independent Poland of 1918--1939. He also gives the definitive account in English of the dominant figure in this story, the Polish freedom fighter and strongman Jozef Pilsudski, whose admirers included Poland's Jews and Adolf Hitler.
author: Richard M. Watt
